e4: The board should prioritize transparency and ethical practices by changing to a new policy without bias. While it may cause short-term difficulties, it is important for the long-term reputation and trust of the firm with investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should accurately represent the financial health and performance of a company, and not manipulate or bias earnings for short-term gains. This protects investors and promotes long-term trust in the company. In this case, the current policy is unethical as it has a systematic bias and relies on investors to adjust their calculations correctly. The new policy would address these concerns by providing unbiased financial data.
e6: As a board member, I would have several questions for the management team to further understand their concerns and assess the risks and benefits of the proposed policy change. I would ask about the specific costs associated with changing the policy and the potential market reaction to any communications or disclosures regarding the change in policy. Additionally, I would seek greater clarity on how the practice of under-reporting earnings affects retail investors, as it raises concerns about equitable treatment for all shareholders.
q9: This question is about a scenario involving ABC company's earnings reporting policies. There isn't an obvious answer about the detection of an interstellar object passing through our solar system.
